etymologies: mid 19th century: from Spanish, based on Latin titulus (see title)

definitions: an accent (~) placed over Spanish n when pronounced ny (as in señor) or Portuguese a or o when nasalized (as in São Paulo), or over a vowel in phonetic transcription, indicating nasalization.
shortDefinitions: accent (~) placed over Spanish n when pronounced ny (as in señor)

definitions: the tilde symbol as a part of a URL.
shortDefinitions: same symbol as part of URL

definitions: a symbol similar to a tilde used in mathematics to indicate similarity, and in logic to indicate negation.
shortDefinitions: symbol similar to tilde used in mathematics and logic to indicate negation
